poem:
Title: The Gambler's Glee

Sunak, at the dawn of day, 
bets won and lost on political sway.
Manifesto time - both glee and rue,
For Tories and Labour, what will ensue?
Oh, to launch first, set the tone;
or last, imprint on minds, alone.
The thrill of gamble, the taste of risk,
In the dawn's light, life's brisk.
Just remember, dear Sunak, in your bliss,
Victory's sweet, but transient as a kiss.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Winning a bet may be the best it’s going to get for Rishi Sunak and his team You win some, you lose some. This week, both Labour and the Tories will reckon they’ve struck lucky with the timings of their manifesto launches – though for very different reasons. It’s always hard to know which is the best launch slot. To go first and set the agenda, with the anxiety that everyone will have soon forgotten". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
